intro: Strobilanthes backeri, commonly known as the "Singapore ironwood," is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its woody stem and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces striking clusters of bright orange or red flowers, which bloom in late summer. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in lowland forests and disturbed areas. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
